profile: Over four years of on the job Software Development experience complemented with over seven years of developing side projects.
Deep understanding of JavaScript with experience in client side, server side and phone environments.
, a popular JavaScript blog with over 10,000 followers on Tumblr. All original content.

summary.main: I'm a Senior Software Developer who works at Zimit, currently developing their first product with a team of developers. I specialize in JavaScript focused technologies like AngularJS and Node.js, but I also have experience with other web stacks like Ruby and Java.
points: JavaScript - client side, server side (Node.js), mobile
HTML/CSS (and various preprocessors like SCSS)
Unix environments (e.g. Linux, Mac OS X)
Full stack development (Node.js, Ruby on Rails, etc.)

summary: This is just a summary of my core skills, for full details

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.summary: I have used JavaScript in client side (browser), server side (Node.js) and mobile (Hybrid apps) environments. I know multiple paradigms of JavaScript including Object Orientation and Functional Programming. Additionally, I have unit tested JavaScript in multiple libraries. Finally, I have done various tech talks on JavaScript to audiences of over 80 people.

skills.name: HTML
skills.summary: I have used HTML in multiple environments like browsers and hybrid mobile applications. I know how to do modern grid-style layouts as well as how to support and convert from legacy table based layouts. Finally, I have used many dynamically generated HTML languages like HAML, JSP and and Jade (now called Pug).

skills.name: CSS (Including Preprocessors)
skills.summary: I have created many types of layouts ranging from complex data driven applications with complex grids to simple websites. This includes responsive designs for mobile phones and tablets. I know of most modern CSS techniques including CSS3. I have also used mutliple CSS preprocessors such as SCSS.

skills.name: Java
skills.summary: I have worked on multiple projects across previous jobs and other projects. I know how to code Java in a standard Object Orieted way and have worked with Java Unit testing (Junit).

skills.name: Ruby On Rails
skills.summary: I used this at one previous intern job for 4 months and have used it across a few side projects. I know how to write code for all layers including the views, controllers and models. I have also done testing using RSpec.

skills.name: Python
skills.summary: Python is a language that keeps coming up for small, but important parts of almost every work experience that I have had. This includes a 4 month internship of doing backend Python development for the Django framework. Like other languages, I have also had experience with unit testing in the form of the unitest framework.

skills.name: SQL
skills.summary: I have used this across multiple jobs and projects. I know how to create and manage databases including how to write pure SQL statements to update, create and delete data without an Object-Relational Mapping tool (ORM).

skills.name: Erlang
skills.summary: I have created a small project at work to monitor all of our services that formed the core of a new larger application now essential to the business. I know about Functional Programming and various OTP (Open Telecom Platform) principles.

skills.name: Apache HTTP Server
skills.summary: I have configured and run Apache servers across multiple Operating Systems. I have also dealt with issues like using multiple different websites on different ports using the same Apache server.

skills.name: Gulp.js (Task Runner)
skills.summary: I converted our entire UI build system at VeriAs from Grunt.js to Gulp.js. I am familiar with writing multiple types of tasks for it like complex builds that do minification, concatenation and so on. I have organized and expanded Gulp code for entire projects adding features like multi-core builds.

skills.name: Grunt.js (Task Runner)
skills.summary: I created build systems for multiple projects while at VeriAs. This included creating complex tasks such as builds that do minification, concatenation and so on.

skills.name: Git (and Github)
skills.summary: I now use Git and Github for all my work and side projects. I know how to create organized branching and commit strategies used to support multiple developers working on different areas of a project at once. I have also managed projects on Github and have created the various Pull Request and Continuous Integration strategies.

skills.name: PostgreSQL
skills.summary: I update and manage a PostgreSQL 9.5 database at work and have done more limited work on it in the past.

skills.name: Linux Admin
skills.summary: Most of my work experiences involved a Linux environment with a focus towards command line driven development. I know how to setup and manage Linux based servers using tools like Screen and how to create automated scripts in Bash to do various tasks. For example, I created a script to install all dependencies for the main Zimit Web Application that works across Ubuntu, OS X and as part of the Docker installation Continuous Integration process

skills.name: Mac OS X Admin
skills.summary: I have developed in various command line heavy technologies on OS X and do so at my job on a daily basis. I also have a good knowledge of various UNIX tools like Bash gained from my Linux experience.

skills.name: Windows Admin
skills.summary: I have done some development in Windows using Java and C#. I have also had to write .bat scripts and do basic admin tasks like managing firewalls in Windows.

skills.name: Docker
skills.summary: I know how to create Docker images from scatch make them communicate and debug their containers.

summary: For older work experiences, see my

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.description: Interface, backend and database work with Angular and Node.js on the companies first product.
points: Helped define the application architecture from front end to backend to the PostgreSQL database.
Developed the testing strategies and improved the various build strategies using tools like Jasmine, Protractor (Selenium based) and HTTP/Socket based API tests.
Work all the way from client side JavaScript and HTML to Node.js with ES6 to a PostgreSQL 9.5 database using tools such as linting and Gulp.js for task running.
Manage the Continuous integration (CI) and build systems using Amazon Web Services (AWS) with custom Docker containers.

jobs.title: Software Developer
jobs.description: I designed and developed interfaces across multiple products (including architecture).
points: Developed the single page UI structure, automation, testing and other essential aspects. Using the JavaScript MVC framework Angular.js and supported by Node.js tasks via Gulp.js (Switched from Grunt.js).
Designed the user experience and help design the general user processes across the various projects.
Ensured that the visual designs are appealing and usable across multiple devices.
Using Angular.js, tested with Jasmine.js and Protractor.js which runs on Selenium. Created a CI server (Jenkins based) to test across multiple browsers and operating systems among other functions.

jobs.title: Co-op Work Term 3 Web Developer
jobs.description: Improved Panda, the internal web application. Panda managed the business from all of the pharmacy sites. Worked in an Agile Environment.
points: Using HTML, SCSS (CSS preprocessor), and jQuery, I designed and updated many front end interfaces.
Implemented server code in Ruby on Rails which connected to a MySQL database.
Improved a small HR application which had a Twitter Bootstrap interface and a Ruby on Rails backend.

education.title: 2008 September - 2013 April, University Of Manitoba, MB
points: B.C.Sc. Honours Degree - Co-operative Option
Concentration in Software Engineering
